columns.text: In this exercise, we will calculate the value today of the TVM lottery winning if we receive $1 million today and receive another payment each year, increasing by $375,000 per year for the next ten years with an interest rate of 6.5%.

In solving the value of the lottery winning, we will consider the following details:

| Particulars               |            |
|---------------------------|------------|
| Initial cash flow         | $1,000,000 |
| Annual cash flow increase | $375,000   |
| Interest rate             | 6.5%       |
| Period                    | 10         |

To determine the total value of the lottery winning today, we will calculate the present value of the future cash flows.

The present value of future cashflows refers to the current value of the sum of a series future cash flows, considering the interest rate and the period. It is calculated using the following formula:

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Present Value} &=\dfrac{{FV}}{\left(1 + r\right)^{t}}
\end{aligned}$$

Where:

$FV$, which refers to the cash flow\
$t$, which represent the period\
$r$, which indicate the discount rate

First, considering the annual increase on the payment of $375,000 per year, project the future cash flows for the next ten years in a year.

Let's now create a projection of the future cash flows for the next ten years by adding the annual increase of 375,000 per year.

| Years | Annual increase ($)            |  Amount ($)          |
|-------|--------------------------------|----------------------|
| 0     |                                |           1,000,000  |
| 1     |                       375,000  |           1,375,000  |
| 2     |                       375,000  |           1,750,000  |
| 3     |                       375,000  |           2,125,000  |
| 4     |                       375,000  |           2,500,000  |
| 5     |                       375,000  |           2,875,000  |
| 6     |                       375,000  |           3,250,000  |
| 7     |                       375,000  |           3,625,000  |
| 8     |                       375,000  |           4,000,000  |
| 9     |                       375,000  |           4,375,000  |
| 10    |                       375,000  |           4,750,000  |

Hence, the future cash flows can be summarized in the table above.

Now that we have the present value of the future cash flows calculate the net present value by combining the values plus the initial cash flow of $1 million.

To calculate the net present value of the future cash flows, we will use the following formula:

$$ \begin{aligned}
NPV &=\text{Initial cash flow}+{PV}_{1}+{PV}_{2}+{PV}_{3}+{PV}_{4}+{PV}_{5}+{PV}_{6}+{PV}_{7}+{PV}_{8}+{PV}_{9}+{PV}_{10}
\end{aligned}$$

Where:

$NPV$, which means the net present value of the cash flows\
$PV$, which refers to the present value of each cash flows

Let's now calculate the net present value of the winning.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{NPV} &= \$1,000,000+\$ 1,291,080+\$ 1,542,904+\$ 1,759,179+ \$ 1,943,308+\$ 2,098,407 +\$ 2,227,336+\$ 2,332,710+\$ 2,416,925+\$ 2,482,170+\$ 2,530,449 
\\[5pt]
&= \boxed{\bf\$21,624,467.72}
\end{aligned}$$

Therefore, based on our calculations, the present value or the value today of the lottery winning from TVM is $21,624,467.72.

To conclude, by projecting the future cash flows of the lottery winning, calculating the future value of each year, and combining the values along with the initial cash received, we determined that the net present worth of the lottery winning today is $21,624,467.72.
